data.enText: to make sth develop or become more active; to encourage sth
The exhibition has stimulated interest in her work.
data.chText: 展览增进了人们对她作品的兴趣。

data.enText: The article can be used to stimulate discussion among students.
data.chText: 这篇文章可用来活跃学生的讨论。

data.enText: to make sb interested and excited about sth
Parents should give children books that stimulate them.
data.chText: 父母应给孩子能启发他们的书。

data.enText: Both men and women are stimulated by erotic photos (= sexually) .
data.chText: 色情照片对男女都有刺激作用。

data.enText: The conference stimulated him to study the subject in more depth.
data.chText: 这次会议促使他更深入地研究那个课题。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: to make a part of the body function
data.chText: 促进（身体某部分）的功能

data.enText: The women were given fertility drugs to stimulate the ovaries.
data.chText: 那些妇女得到了促进卵巢功能的生育药。
感官 / 智力 / 性 / 视觉 / 身体刺激

simple_means.memory_skill: stimul- 刺,刺激 + -ate 做,造成

means: 促进(身体某部分)的功能

ex.enText: Are you excited about going to London?
ex.chText: 你要去伦敦了，感到兴奋吗？

ex.enText: The Christmas presents excited the little girl very much.
ex.chText: 圣诞礼物让那个小姑娘很激动。

synonyms.bx: 尤指使某人对即将发生的事感到兴奋。

ex.enText: Their aim is to incite religious hatred.
ex.chText: 他们意在煽动宗教仇恨。

synonyms.bx: 指用语言刺激或煽动他人犯罪、打斗等，常与介词 to 连用。

ex.enText: Praise always stimulates him to work harder.
ex.chText: 表扬总能激励他更加努力。

synonyms.bx: 指外界因素刺激人或事物的发展。

ex.enText: Jay has been stirring things up.
They were trying to stir up trouble at the meeting.

synonyms.bx: 指挑起不愉快的情绪或事态。

tr: cause to be alert and energetic
cause to act in a specified manner
example: The ads induced me to buy a VCR
My children finally got me to buy a computer
My wife made me buy a new sofa
the infection precipitated a high fever and allergic reactions

tr: stir the feelings, emotions, or peace of
example: the civil war shook the country

example.ex: America's priority is rightly to stimulate its economy...
example.tran: 美国的首要任务自然是刺激经济。

example.ex: The Russian health service has stimulated public interest in home cures.
example.tran: 俄罗斯的公共医疗服务已经激起了公众对家庭治疗的兴趣。

value.def: To stimulate something means to encourage it to begin or develop further.

example.ex: Bill was stimulated by the challenge...
example.tran: 这个挑战让比尔热情高涨。

example.ex: I was stimulated to examine my deepest thoughts.
example.tran: 我深受启发，开始审视自己内心深处的想法。

value.def: If you are stimulated by something, it makes you feel full of ideas and enthusiasm.

example.ex: It is a complex yet stimulating book...
example.tran: 这是一本情节复杂但能振奋人心的书。
气氛总是那么的令人振奋。

example.ex: Many enjoy the mental stimulation of a challenging job.
example.tran: 很多人喜欢富有挑战性的工作所带来的强烈的精神刺激。

example.ex: Exercise stimulates the digestive and excretory systems...
example.tran: 锻炼能促进消化和排泄系统的活动。

example.ex: The production of melanin in the skin is stimulated by exposure to the sun...
example.tran: 皮肤暴露在阳光下就很容易生成黑色素。

example.ex: The body is stimulated to build up resistance.
example.tran: 刺激身体以增强抵抗力。

value.def: If something stimulates a part of a person's body, it causes it to move or start working.

trans: 刺激内需；刺激国内需求
